html: Nowhere is the power of this job creation more evident than #Iowa, where the 2.4 percent unemployment rate is the lowest in the nation. There are 64,000 plus jobs open in Iowa right now! Over 1.6 million Iowans are employed – the most in our state’s history.

html: The tight labor market has drawn workers off of the sidelines. Folks that have been unemployed or underemployed are finding work.

html: 3/3 Iowans know that you don’t take a vacation until the job is done. That’s why I introduced the No Budget, No Vacation Act, which would prevent Congress from going on recess if we don’t pass a budget & fund the gov’t on time. I will bring this up for a vote when we reconvene.
text: 3/3 Iowans know that you don’t take a vacation until the job is done. That’s why I introduced the No Budget, No Vacation Act, which would prevent Congress from going on recess if we don’t pass a budget & fund the gov’t on time. I will bring this up for a vote when we reconvene.

html: 2/3 The Joint Select Committee on Budget and Appropriations Reform, on which I serve, is tasked with fixing this process so we finish our work on time. Ironically, halfway through our markup, the Committee decided to adjourn until just a few days before our statutory deadline.

html: The $12B in farm aid announced today will provide a short-term fix, but it’s not a long-term solution. As I've said all along, nobody wins in a trade war. We must continue to expand & open markets, protect the #RFS & allow Iowa products to be sold across the globe. #iagov
text: The $12B in farm aid announced today will provide a short-term fix, but it’s not a long-term solution. As I've said all along, nobody wins in a trade war. We must continue to expand & open markets, protect the #RFS & allow Iowa products to be sold across the globe. #iagov

html: We need a longer-term strategy to ensure farmers are able to sell their goods around the globe. I will continue to push the administration to open up new markets & finalize trade deals, steps that will go the distance to ensure the success of Iowa’s agricultural economy.
text: We need a longer-term strategy to ensure farmers are able to sell their goods around the globe.  I will continue to push the administration to open up new markets & finalize trade deals, steps that will go the distance to ensure the success of Iowa’s agricultural economy.

html: Ten years ago today, the Cedar Rapids community was devastated by flooding, but what we saw after the flood embodied the people of Iowa. We saw resilience, kindness and generosity. The community came together to rebuild and help others in need. (1/2)
